Now, to be clear, it's not that Meyer is arguing that there's been an actual increase in the number of children who struggle with gender identity disorder.

This behavior that used to be ignored by parents, they didn't use to come to my office at all, because I think the parents really accepted this as just normal exploration and ignored it.
